alert.note: Alert for Lower Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 6:51AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Plaquemines Parish through 715 AM CDT... At 650 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout near Buras, or 19 miles southeast of Port Sulphur, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buras, Boothville-venice, Boothville, Buras-triumph, Empire and Boothville Asos. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
